manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MSI Geforce 210 1024 MB DDR3 PCI-Express 2.0 Graphics Card MD1G/D3 MSI Afterburner Overclocking Utility -Support 2D/3D customized profile -Support burn-in stability test. -Support Multi-GPU control.Military Class Concept Components -SSC (Solid State Chock) has No Buzz noise and higher current for better overclocking ability. All Solid CAP for longer lifespan.Native HDMI Output -Support both 1080P HD movie playback and 7.1 Channel audio transmission.Low Profile Design -One slot thermal and low profile design work perfect with slim or smaller system.

Bundle MSI developed driver and utilities MSI Live Update Series(Live Graphics Card BIOS & Live Graphics Card Driver) Automatically online download & update Graphics Card BIOS & Drivers, reduce the risk of getting the wrong files, and never have the trouble on web site searching. MSI Graphics Card Driver MSI StarOSD StarOSD can monitor system information, adjust monitor figuration, and overclock system. MSI Dual Core Center MSI Live MSI Live including all real time life information you need, such as Live MSI Product News, Live Daily Information, Live Personal Schedule Manager, Live Search and more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good budget card for non gaming use
reviews.reviewText: I needed a cheap graphics card for my Home Server/OPNSense Router setup and this was my choice. It works great for what I need it for, it shipped very quick. While it's not a gaming card, it serves the purpose I needed it to do very well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars DELL XPS 8700 Dual Monitor works great but there is a trick to it. No more black screen and 5 BEEPS.
reviews.reviewText: DELL XPS 8700 Windows 8.1 this card works just fine for dual monitors. But you will need to go into BIOS and disable secure boot mode. I used the onboard graphics while setting this up. I used the HDMI plug (it has a cap hiding it, just pull the cap out and plug in your HDMI TV or monitor). Take your graphics card OUT when doing this. Restart you your computer and Hit F2 when you see the Dell splash screen. Now arrow over to BIOS and change the setting to disable secure boot mode. Exit and restart your computer. Now shut down the computer and put in the new graphics card hook up the HDMI TV and monitor and restart. You should now be good to go.BLACK screens and 5 Beeps!I started out assuming I could just plug and play. But I ended up with black screens and was getting 5 beeps. People kept saying the 5 beeps meant the battery on the mother board was bad or needed to be reseated. That is if you get 5 beeps over and over not 5 beeps and then stops. Luckily I could put my old card back in to do the research. I did not realize there was an onboard HDMI hook up on my DELL until I kept exchanging the cards in and out. I had a hard time getting rid of the drivers I loaded from the start, I used the CD that came with the card. But with the drivers loaded the method above would not work. I had to delete them first which I could not do without the card in place and could not see the screens with the card hooked up to the motherboard. I ended up refreshing my computer to a date before I bought the graphics card and could start from scratch.I have been using this MSI Geforce 210 for a couple of weeks now and I am very happy with it. I did not want to spend a lot since I am not a gamer.I just wanted to be able to watch movies on my big screen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Make certain you have received a new OEM PCIE card and NOT a returned/refurbished card.
reviews.reviewText: I gave this item, MSI Nvidia Geforce 210, “1 STAR = POOR rating” because I ordered a NEW unit, but I received a RETURNED/REFURBISHED PCIE card. I know that it was NOT new for the following reasons.1. The package for a new unit would have been in a shrink-fit cellophane wrapper, this was not.2. The package should have contained a low profile bracket, this did not.3. The cardboard container did not have any internal structure that would prevent the PCIE card from moving around.4. But the dead giveaway is that the board was NOT covered with a static resistant wrapper. Every computer item I have ever bought had a static resistant wrapper.I did confirm that the Graphics Processor Card was functional, but I have no idea of its previous history.I consider this UNACCEPTABLE, but I kept the card because I was in dire straits and needed a working computer.I believe the item should should have been classified as RETURNED/REFURBISHED.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I LIKE it....
reviews.reviewText: What a great little card. I was a little concerned upon first opening the (poorly sealed) box because I saw immediately that the card was attached to a wide profile strip for a wider PC case. THEN I noticed that the 3 ports easily can be unscrewed for removal and placement into two slim profile metal strips and then be secured with the same screws FURTHERMORE then to be placed inside case using/taking up TWO (2) two spaces NOT one (1) not 1 space but 2 spaces. (Notice the emphasis by way of reiteration here? I'm trying to help. This isn't always easy.)Finally, in case you're tired from reading a lot of reviews already or whatever today, NOTE: only one slot, but occupying TWO spaces is what this graphics card does in 'Slim Profile' cases BUT only 1 space, NOT blocking thus keeping available an available slot in standard Wide Profile cases.So, if you're buying this to use in a SLIM profile case, make sure you have at least two spaces available BECAUSE upon having the two in place, one of your available motherboard slots will no longer be available for use.So we know we're talking about the same card here as reviews CAN get mixed; this MSI GeForce 210 1024 MB (that's ~ > 1 GB) DDR3 PCI-Express 2.0 Graphics Card MD1G/D3 in my opinion IS, I feel, a sweet little graphics card. It hums right along with its small, quiet fan and so forth. pretty smooth really.I'm not a gamer, so I can't speak for game performance; however it was a very, very acceptable upgrade for ME personally for use in/on a PC I use only occasionally, so the system I put this in is not in my everyday PC. My supposition just the same however though is that for general everyday use; spreadsheets, Word Processing, web access; general purpose stuff, etc., you won't be disappointed. In fact if you find you're as happy with your decision to get this as I am; that you will find you're feeling pretty good about it and pretty happy at that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars would not work on my desktop HP Pavilion
reviews.reviewText: Nice card but my HP Pavilion balked during the boot process. The card initially worked with my monitor and then when the PC went into the boot process, all I got was a black screen. I am sure there might be a setting in the bios that needed to be set so the system could use the card. I am not familiar enough with the bios settings to resolve the problem and could find not help on the internet and so had to return the card.
Muy buen producto y muy buena calidad

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to install, setup and use, excellence value/performance
reviews.reviewText: Originally brought an AMD video card that did not work out and had it exchanged for this MSI GeForce 210. First impression is a professional product; all ports and connector have protective cap/cover; circuit board is of high quality; on top it comes with a pair of low profile brackets that could save me another $15. The installation is as smooth as it could be.Without doing any pre-installation steps, simply turn off the computer, plug in the card, connect the monitor to the VGA port, turn everything on, and the standard 600x800 screen comes up. That is it, the video card automatically becomes the primary display. Unlike the previous video card, I got blank screen all the way. The downloading of drivers and utility is smooth but with a minor glitch. The latest version download button on msi web page is grey outed and need to choose the next one down on the list. There is one problem though once the drivers are installed.The on-board audio speaker is disabled. After some googling, it seems to be a rather common issue; the solution is to get into the computer's BIOS setup to re-enable the on-board audio! However, this audio issue does not affect the HDMI output; there is good sound if the video card is hooked up to a TV via HDMI.For dual display, simply connect a second device, no need to do anything in Windows, as in my case a hd tv is added seamlessly and effortlessly. Finally, another plus for this card is the cooling fan; without a fan like the AMD one, the heat sink could be to too hot to touch. Over all, I am very pleased with this msi geforce card. The installing and setup is as smooth as it should be. Performance wise, it serves my basic needs well. Highly recommended. By the way, my computer is a HP low profile desktop with on-board video and audio running Windows 7 Home Ed.

Definitely not a gaming video card (you can tell by the price) but quite ok for everyday office work. I mostly bought it to render 3D views in KiCad v7.0. It does the job. Note that it only supports openGL up to version 3.1 and DirectX 10.1. You also have to download and install the driver from NVIDIA for the best results. (I'm using Windows 10.)

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente producto, económico y funcional, adecuado para un uso normal.
Ayuda a procesadores sin gráficos integrados
reviews.reviewText: Esta GPU no tendrá la potencia para mover juegos actuales, pero ayuda a generar imagen en pantalla en armados de PCs cuyo procesador no cuenta con gráficos integrados. Aunque si lo que deseas es jugar, entonces es recomendable una GPU de mayor poder.
